author: Special Correspondent
text:
Dr. Abdul Kalam Science Centre is making arrangements on Wednesday for viewing the penumbral lunar eclipse, a celestial event in which a part of sunlight will be blocked by earth’s shadow.

In a press note, M. Dwarakanath, Director, said the eclipse will start at 6.22 p.m. it will peak at 6.24 p.m. and last until 7.24 p.m. It will be visible in east direction when the moon is rising, the director said.
title: Arrangements made to view lunar eclipse
